title: pawanjain
author: pawanjain
created_time: March 23, 2023, 02:19:22 PMLast edit: May 15, 2023, 05:02:33 PM by pawanjain
content: India along with UAE is creating a path for CBDC based payment method which will be used to facilitate remittances and trade.USA is currently the middleman imposing their charges on these transactions through USD based settlements.With the creation of new CBDC, the USD charges will be vanished and thus USA will be eliminated as a middleman.This will definitely provoke USA against India but this will eventually happen and thus valuation of USD will decrease over time.Twitter LinkSource: https://cointelegraph.com/news/india-uae-to-explore-cbdc-bridge-to-facilitate-trade-remittances-without-usd

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: It's definitely a step towards better future. US is the most evil country in the world for obvious reasons and USD is their main strength. This needs to be eliminated from the system entirely. But honestly I am not sure if these things will materialize. As of now India maintains a good relationship with US. If this CBDC becomes a reality then that relationship will not take much time to change. Indian government will have to balance this properly.

comments.author: teosanru
comments.body: Quote from: pawanjain on March 23, 2023, 02:19:22 PMIndia along with UAE is creating a path for CBDC based payment method which will be used to facilitate remittances and trade.USA is currently the middleman imposing their charges on these transactions through USD based settlements.With the creation of new CBDC, the USD charges will be vanished and thus USA will be eliminated as a middleman.This will definitely provoke USA against India but this will eventually happen and thus valuation of USD will decrease over time.Twitter LinkSource: https://cointelegraph.com/news/india-uae-to-explore-cbdc-bridge-to-facilitate-trade-remittances-without-usdThis is a good step and if you see overall most of the countries around the world are doing this. They are starting to use their own currencies than using USD for international trades and remittances. But in your post I don't understand one thing. What are the charges you are talking about? Anyone can transact in USD, there are no charges involved to just use it. The only issue is the forex risk that one carries when it has to trade in a third party currency, rest I don't think there are any transaction charges on this.
